author: The Telegraph
title: A Taste of Australia with Donna Hay
text: You are invited to celebrate the best of Australian food and wine at an exclusive culinary event to be held at Australia House in London on Friday 11 or Saturday 12 September, 2015. On each evening, a four-course dinner menu, created by Australia’s leading food editor and cookbook author Donna Hay, will be paired with exceptional Australian wines hand-picked by the Telegraph’s food expert Xanthe Clay. The evenings will be held in the prestigious surroundings of Australia House, a Grade II listed building and the longest continually occupied foreign mission in the capital. At each event, there will be a chance to win a gourmet getaway to Australia worth £10,000, including business class flights with leading airline Etihad. Using fine Australian ingredients, Donna Hay’s bespoke menu – inspired by her holiday memories in Australia – will be designed to showcase the country’s outstanding produce from land and sea. Pop-up restaurant at Australia House, September 2014 Television cook, author and editor-in-chief of her own magazine, she has inspired a generation of Australians to celebrate the abundance of fresh produce on their doorsteps, and her refreshing attitude to food has influenced home cooks in more than 82 countries. Australia’s exceptional cuisine is one of the country’s best-kept secrets and is finding its place as one of the most sophisticated, fresh and exciting food and wine havens in the world. The country’s producers revel in the creativity of a food and wine culture not bound by tradition. This, combined with Australia’s wonderful climate and stunning scenic beauty, makes for an incredible feast. Book your tickets to either evening and see for yourself why there’s nothing like Australia for outstanding food and wine. You'll enjoy live music and a glass of sparkling wine on arrival before taking your seats to savour an entree, two separate main courses and a dessert which will be paired with wines from Australia’s many famous wine regions, picked and presented by Xanthe Clay to complement Donna Hay’s dishes. Both experts will present their choices and speak to diners individually about their inspiration for the food and wine served, and guests will have the opportunity to ask questions. The evening costs £100 a head and you will receive your tickets in the post two weeks before the event takes place. Donna Hay’s dinner menu will be able to cater for special dietary requirements; simply state your preferences when you place your order. You will be required to bring a form of photo identification with you on the night for access to the High Commission. Book your tickets now » Alternatively, call 0800 542 5859 Events line is open from 9am to 5pm Monday-Friday and from 9am to 1pm on Saturdays.
